DataElement.preferredName: Ancillary Study If Yes Specify Prothrombin Time Float
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A measurement from secondary study data capturing the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin in seconds.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ancillary Study If Yes Specify Prothrombin Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A study that is secondary to another study._A directive to provide a more specific response if the answer to the question is yes._A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A study that is secondary to another study.

Concepts.definition: A study that is secondary to another study.

Property.preferredDefinition: A directive to provide a more specific response if the answer to the question is yes.:A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

Concepts.definition: A directive to provide a more specific response if the answer to the question is yes.

A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
